articles.title: The Thunder are winning a ton of games, again. They don't let wins, or losses, faze them much
articles.summary: The Oklahoma City Thunder should have been angry.  It was a game that saw Shai Gilgeous-Alexander get called for a crucial offensive foul with 1:14 remaining (the NBA said a day later it wasn't a foul), the Thunder waste a 12-point lead and referees missing a backcourt violation on Heat guard Norman Powell in the final seconds.  The defending NBA champions are winning far more often than they lose; a victory in Cleveland on Monday pushed Oklahoma City's record to 36-8, the best in the league by
articles.author: TIM REYNOLDS

articles.title: Curt Cignetti finishes his masterpiece, coaching unbeaten Indiana to title in his 2nd season
articles.summary: Curt Cignetti came to Indiana to win championships.  The old-school, blunt-spoken coach who began his Hoosiers tenure with a promise to bring swift success to the losingest program in college football completed his masterpiece on Monday night, guiding Indiana to a 27-21 win over Miami in the College Football Playoff final and the first national championship in school history.  Cignetti accomplished what few imagined could be done ‚Äî at least not this quickly.
articles.author: ALANIS THAMES

articles.title: Catcher J.T. Realmuto and Philadelphia Phillies finalize $45 million, 3-year contract
articles.summary: Catcher J.T. Realmuto and the Philadelphia Phillies finalized their $45 million, three-year contract on Tuesday.  A three-time All-Star and two-time Gold Glove winner, Realmuto made his decision a month after designated hitter Kyle Schwarber also chose to remain with the Phillies, agreeing to a $150 million, five-year deal.  Realmuto, who turns 35 in March, hit .257 with 12 homers and 52 RBIs in 134 games last year, when he tied for the major league lead with 132 games at catcher.

articles.title: Ducks hold off Rangers 5-3 for 4th straight win following 9-game losing streak
articles.summary: Alex Killorn broke a second-period tie, rugged newcomer Jeffrey Viel scored his first goal of the season and the Anaheim Ducks beat the New York Rangers 5-3 on Monday night.  Cutter Gauthier scored twice on his 22nd birthday ‚Äî the second into an empty net in the final minute ‚Äî to push his season total to 22.  Mason McTavish also scored to help Anaheim to its fourth victory in a row following a nine-game losing streak.

articles.title: Warriors season effectively over after worst possible Jimmy Butler news
articles.summary: Any hope of the Golden State Warriors winning this year's NBA championship is effectively over after the worst possible outcome on Jimmy Butler's knee injury.
articles.author: Peter O'Keefe

articles.title: Konecny scores twice as Flyers end 6-game skid with 2-1 victory at Vegas
articles.summary: Travis Konecny scored twice for his first multigoal game this season and the Philadelphia Flyers defeated the Vegas Golden Knights 2-1 on Monday.  Philadelphia stopped a six-game slide and ended Vegas‚Äô seven-game winning streak.  Konecny has 17 goals this season.
articles.author: W.G. RAMIREZ

articles.title: Pistons vs. Celtics final score: Detroit cements status as best in the East
articles.summary: Detroit relies on their defense to deliver another win against one of the league‚Äôs best

articles.title: QB Diana Flores hypes flag football ahead of its 2028 LA Olympics debut, now an open book on subject
articles.summary: Quarterback Diana Flores has won world titles and MVPs on the flag football field.  This, though, confirmed just how far-reaching women's flag football has become ‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs standout Patrick Mahomes once referred to her by name and mentioned her being a QB.  Flores, the signal caller for the reigning world champion Mexico squad, is doing all she can these days to build up the sport ahead of flag football making its Olympic debut at the 2028 Los Angeles Games.
articles.author: PAT GRAHAM

articles.title: Warriors star Jimmy Butler goes down with right knee injury in win over Heat
articles.summary: Warriors star Jimmy Butler injured his right knee midway through the third quarter of a 135-112 win Monday night against his former Miami Heat team after he scored 17 points, a big blow for Golden State.  The knee buckled upon his landing and Butler screamed, grimaced and grabbed at his knee while down for a couple of minutes.
articles.author: JANIE McCAULEY

articles.title: Fernando Mendoza's clutch play against Miami leads undefeated Indiana to its 1st national title
articles.summary: A historic season for Fernando Mendoza ended with a national title.  The Heisman Trophy winner didn't have his best statistical game Monday night, but he came up big when it mattered.  Offensive momentum slowed for Indiana in the third quarter and the Hoosiers punted three times.
articles.author: MAURA CAREY

articles.title: Warriors G Jimmy Butler goes down with right knee injury against Heat, will have MRI
articles.summary: Warriors star Jimmy Butler was helped off the court with a right knee injury at the 7:41 mark of the third quarter of a 135-112 victory against his former Miami team Monday night.  After the play, Butler was asking for two free throws, a positive sign to coach Steve Kerr that his spirits were good and ‚Äúhopefully that's a good sign.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWe're all really concerned but we'll know more after the MRI,‚Äù Kerr said.
articles.author: JANIE McCAULEY

articles.title: Knight makes 32 saves as the Blackhawks beat Toews and the Jets 2-0
articles.summary: Spencer Knight made 32 saves, Jason Dickinson scored and the Chicago Blackhawks beat Jonathan Toews and the Winnipeg Jets 2-0 on Monday night.  Connor Bedard added an empty-net goal as the Blackhawks stopped a three-game slide.  It was Bedard's first goal since returning from a right shoulder injury.

articles.title: Duclair scores twice as Islanders win 4-3 to extend Canucks' losing streak to 11 games

Wembanyama had a season-high seven 3-pointers and finished with 33 points and 10 rebounds, and the San Antonio Spurs beat the Utah Jazz 123-110 on Monday.
